org.knime.core.data

Class ExtensibleUtilityFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.knime.core.data.DataValue.UtilityFactory
      • org.knime.core.data.ExtensibleUtilityFactory
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BinaryObjectDataValue.BinaryObjectUtilityFactory, BitVectorValue.BitVectorUtilityFactory, BooleanValue.BooleanUtilityFactory, ByteVectorValue.ByteVectorUtilityFactory, CollectionDataValue.CollectionUtilityFactory, ComplexNumberValue.ComplexNumberUtilityFactory, DateAndTimeUtility, DoubleValue.DoubleUtilityFactory, FuzzyIntervalValue.FuzzyIntervalUtilityFactory, FuzzyNumberValue.FuzzyNumberUtilityFactory, ImageValue.ImageValueUtilityFactory, IntervalValue.IntervalUtilityFactory, IntValue.IntUtilityFactory, LongValue.LongUtilityFactory, PMMLValue.PMMLUtilityFactory, PNGImageValue.ImageCellUtilityFactory, PortObjectValue.PortObjectUtilityFactory, StringValue.StringUtilityFactory, XMLValue.XMLUtilityFactory

    public abstract class ExtensibleUtilityFactory
extends DataValue.UtilityFactory
    Since:
    2.8
    Author:
    Thorsten Meinl, KNIME.com, Zurich, Switzerland

    • Constructor Detail

      • ExtensibleUtilityFactory

        public ExtensibleUtilityFactory(Class<? extends DataValue> valueClass)
        Creates a new utility factory that is responsible for the given value class.
        Parameters:
        valueClass - the value class for which this factory is responsible

    • Method Detail

      • readPreferredRendererFromPreferences

        @Deprecated
protected void readPreferredRendererFromPreferences()
        Deprecated. this method is only used for reading old renderer settings from the MoleculeUtilityFactory. Do not call or override this method.
        Reads and sets the preferred renderers from the preferences.

      • setPreferredRenderer

        public final void setPreferredRenderer(String rendererId)
        Sets the preferred renderer using the ID of its factory. Please think twice before using this method since the preferred renderer should usually only be changed by the user via the preference page.
        Parameters:
        rendererId - the factory's ID name or null if the preferred renderer should be unset

      • setDefaultRenderer

        public final void setDefaultRenderer(String rendererId)
        Sets the default renderer using the ID of its factory. The default renderer must never be null and it must exist.
        Parameters:
        rendererId - the factory's ID name
        Since:
        2.9

      • addRendererFactory

        protected final void addRendererFactory(DataValueRendererFactory fac,
                                        boolean suggestAsDefault)
        Adds a factory to the list of available renderers. This method should not be used because all renderers are better registered via the extension point.
        Parameters:
        fac - a renderer factory
        suggestAsDefault - true if this renderer should be used as default renderer, false otherwise. This will override any existing default renderer.

      • getAvailableRenderers

        public Collection<DataValueRendererFactory> getAvailableRenderers()
        Returns a (unmodifiable) set of renderer factories for this data value. If no renderer factories are registered (highly unlikely), an empty set is returned.
        Returns:
        a set of renderer factories

      • getDefaultRenderer

        public DataValueRendererFactory getDefaultRenderer()
        Returns the default renderer for this data value. If no renderer is registered with the data value (highly unlikely) null is returned.
        Returns:
        a renderer factory or null

      • getPreferredRenderer

        public DataValueRendererFactory getPreferredRenderer()
        Returns the preferred renderer for this data value. If no preferred renderer is set for the data value, null is returned.
        Returns:
        a renderer factory or null

      • getName

        public abstract String getName()
        Returns a name for the data value this utility factory is responsible for.
        Returns:
        a (short) name

      • getRendererFamily

        protected final DataValueRendererFamily getRendererFamily(DataColumnSpec spec)
        Returns a family of all renderers this type natively supports. Derived classes should override this method to provide their own renderer family for the native value class.

        Views that rely on renderer implementations will get a list of all available renderers by invoking DataType.getRenderer(DataColumnSpec) on the column's DataType which makes sure that all renderer implementations of compatible values are returned.

        Overrides:
        getRendererFamily in class DataValue.UtilityFactory
        Parameters:
        spec - the DataColumnSpec of the column for which the renderers are used. Most of the renderer implementations won't need column domain information but some do. For instance a class that renders the double value in the column according to the min/max values in the column domain.
        Returns:
        null

      • getPreferenceKey

        public final String getPreferenceKey()
        Returns the preference key for the preferred renderer for this factory's value class.
        Returns:
        the preference key

      • getAllFactories

        public static Collection<? extends ExtensibleUtilityFactory> getAllFactories()
        Returns a list with all existing utility factories.
        Returns:
        an (unmodifiable) list of utility factories

      • getPreferenceKey

        public static final String getPreferenceKey(Class<? extends DataValue> valueClass)
        Returns the preference key for the preferred renderer for the given value class.
        Parameters:
        valueClass - any data value class
        Returns:
        the preference key

      • getGroupName

        public String getGroupName()
        Returns the name of a group the data value belongs to. This group name is used e.g. in the preferences in order to group data types. You can define you own group but returning a new, yet unused group name. But beware of spelling errors if you want to join an existing group.
        The default group if this method is not overridden is Other.
        Returns:
        a group name
